comments.body: Yeah, WTF. AFAICT nothing imports this -- and it has tests in it, but nose won't see them, right, because nose only consider modules whose name begin with `test_`? So I guess it's currently harmless, though maybe we should just delete the file?
I was going to take a closer look at it later on. It may have been part of the development process.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +10,14 @@from np.testing.utils import build_err_msg

# Fixme: this does not look right.
np.seterr(all='ignore')
